meanings.definition: A direction or route taken or to be taken.
meanings.sent1: She followed the course of the river to find her way back home.
meanings.sent2: The ship changed its course to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent3: The GPS kept insisting on changing the course, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: In life, we often have to navigate through the course of challenges to reach our goals.
meanings.sent5: The course of history was forever altered by that one decision.

meanings.definition: A series of lectures or lessons in a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: He signed up for a cooking course to improve his culinary skills.
meanings.sent2: The online course on coding was very informative and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The course on ancient civilizations made her feel like a time traveler.
meanings.sent4: The course on astronomy opened up a whole new universe of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Taking a course on photography helped her capture the beauty of the world.

meanings.definition: A continuous horizontal layer of brick, stone, or other material in a wall.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully laid each course of bricks to build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle walls were constructed with multiple courses of stones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to climb the wall by stepping on each course of bricks.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design of the wall was highlighted by the alternating courses of stones.
meanings.sent5: The crumbling wall revealed the different courses of materials used in its construction.
